title: How do I create a screenshot of my problem?
summary: A user's guide to creating a screenshot of their problem for uploading to the support forum.

title: What is the Mozilla Maintenance Service?
summary: Firefox and Thunderbird install Mozilla Maintenance Service to allow seamless background updates. Learn how it works and how to disable or remove it.

title: Signatures
summary: This article explains how to create and use custom signatures (text or images that are automatically appended to messages).

title: Global Search
summary: Thunderbird includes a message indexing system that improves search performance and displays faceted (categorized) search results.

title: Quick Filter Toolbar
summary: The Quick Filter toolbar is used to limit the number of messages that are displayed in the message list. Learn more about how to use it.

title: Manual Account Configuration
summary: This article will show you how to manually configure the basic settings you need to send and receive emails with Thunderbird.

title: FAQ Changing IMAP to POP
summary: If your mail server supports both IMAP and POP, Thunderbird will use IMAP by default. Use these instructions to manually configure a POP account.

title: Archived Messages
summary: This article explains how the "archive" feature of Thunderbird works.

title: Automatic Account Configuration
summary: Setting up a new account with Thunderbird is easy. All you need to do is provide your user name and password for your email provider and your email address.

title: Keyboard shortcuts - perform common Thunderbird tasks quickly
summary: Keyboard shortcuts are quick key combinations that replace mouse navigation. This is a list of commonly used keyboard shortcuts in Thunderbird.

title: Profiles - Where Thunderbird stores your messages and other user data
summary: Thunderbird saves personal information such as messages, passwords and user preferences in a set of files called a "profile".

title: Troubleshoot Mode Thunderbird
summary: How to use Thunderbird's Troubleshoot Mode to find and fix problems, especially if they are caused by add-ons.

title: Thunderbird and Gmail
summary: Thunderbird can be set up to work seamlessly with Google's Gmail. Messages will be synchronized between your local version of Thunderbird and web-based Gmail.

title: Changing IMAP to POP
summary: As of Thunderbird 3, the new Automatic Account Configuration Wizard can help you configure your connection to your email provider, but only if your provider is in Mozilla's database of Internet Service Providers or recognized by Thunderbird. While most of the large providers are included, many smaller ones are not yet in the account configuration database.

title: Mozilla Crash Reporter TB
summary: The Mozilla Crash Reporter dialog box appears when Thunderbird crashes and lets you send a crash report. Learn how it works and how to access your crash reports.

title: Creating a Newsgroup Account
summary: Thunderbird can be used to read messages from and write messages to Usenet newsgroups.

title: Thunderbird and Hotmail
summary: Thunderbird can be used as a client for all of Microsoft's email services. You can still use Hotmail's web-based application - Thunderbird will synchronize messages.

title: Thunderbird and Comcast
summary: Thunderbird can be used as a client for a Comcast email account. Thunderbird will download messages from the Comcast server and store them on your local system.

title: IMAP Synchronization
summary: IMAP stands for the Internet Message Access Protocol. It enables a mail client (such as Thunderbird) to access messages stored on a mail server. It is more modern and fully featured than POP (Post Office Protocol), which is the other major protocol for accessing mail messages. Most email providers now support IMAP. To see whether your account uses IMAP or POP, check the Server Settings page in the Account Settings.

title: Cannot receive messages
summary: If you cannot receive messages, this page provides a series of steps you can use to check for common problems.

title: Thunderbird Crashes
summary: A crash is what happens when Thunderbird closes unexpectedly. After a crash, the Mozilla Crash Reporter gives you the option to report it to Mozilla.

title: Updating Thunderbird
summary: Thunderbird automatically updates itself by default but you can always do a manual update. Learn how to update Thunderbird.

title: Thunderbird FAQ
summary: This article provides general information about Thunderbird.

title: Thunderbird Software Update Failed
summary: This article presents possible solutions to this problem and workarounds to get Thunderbird updated.

title: How to disable or change the Thunderbird start page
summary: Change the Thunderbird start page to any webpage, or set it to a blank page.

title: Thunderbird and Sympatico
summary: To configure Thunderbird to send messages via your Sympatico email account, make sure your account settings are set as shown below.

title: Using Identities
summary: When you configure an account, Thunderbird creates a default "identity" for the account that contains information like your name, your email address, signature, etc.

title: Thunderbird add-ons - frequently asked questions
summary: Add-ons are extensions and other additions that add new functionality to Thunderbird or change its appearance.

title: Thunderbird and Yahoo
summary: How to set up Yahoo! services in Thunderbird.

title: Cannot send messages
summary: If you cannot send messages with Thunderbird, this page provides a series of steps you can follow to check for common problems.

summary: This article explains how you can switch to Thunderbird from your current mail application, such as Windows Mail, Outlook or also Mail on Mac OS and Evolution on Linux.

summary: This article will show you how to install Thunderbird on Linux.

summary: This article describes how to install Thunderbird on Mac OS.

summary: This page describes the keystroke combinations used to access various search functions in Thunderbird.

title: Compacting folders
summary: This article explains how Thunderbird stores messages on a disk drive and why it is necessary to periodically compact (purge).

summary: How to move Thunderbird data (accounts, messages, passwords) to a new computer.

title: Names but no Email Addresses are Displayed
summary: I can only see the message sender's name, not address!

summary: Make Thunderbird require you to enter a primary password in order to view or use passwords you've told Thunderbird to remember.

summary: If you need to set up a meeting, and keep track of who's attending and who is not,  Lightning can do this as well as allow you to send invitations to people who do not have Thunderbird/Lightning, including Microsoft Outlook users!

title: Vacation Response
summary: A "vacation response" (also known as "out of office response" or "away message") is an automatic message that is generated by the mail server in response to incoming messages. It is used to inform people who are sending you emails that you are not available.

title: Using Multiple Profiles
summary: Thunderbird saves personal information such as messages, passwords and user preferences in a "profile". This article describes how to use multiple profiles.

summary: This page describes Thunderbird's configuration options for attachments.
